Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a little older, HOWEVER, it was spotless and very well maintained. The staff was great. The grounds have fountains, BBQ grills and picnic tables. Near Scottsdale, and plenty of restaurants near by (by car). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Doubting Thomas Road La Quinta Gets The Job Done”
Reviews.Author: tripspark
Reviews.Content: An entire world exists between B- and C+. I have spent years of my mundane life in this world, specifically during my time in public schools. I spent 3 nights here recently, where a friendly desk clerk and efficient housekeeper crafted a 79.5% achievement for their establishment, if I've a grader - B-. Big points vanished with the missing amenities (out-of-order snack machine, for example, was the only one available) and grounds keeping ( big orange cones in the cactus garden). Other flaws, that could be remedied easily are worn-down carpeting and older, tube-style televisions. A standard continental breakfast offered nothing original. Perhaps the addition of a local citrus item would add a touch of thoughtfulness? No arguing with waffle makers, powdered eggs, fruit loops and coffee with creamer in those little white plastic tubs that say mini-moos. (Other stuff like muffins and bagel and yogurt are offered.) The swimming pool is pretty small. The outdoor hot tub is good; its tiled and the jets are well-placed. A Circle K and a paved, walking/biking trail known as "The Greenway," lie within super-easy walking distance. The parking situation requires one to walk through a tunnel, and around an elevator, staircases and landscaping to get to a room. The small goldfish pond had no fish or visible life other than algae and appeared half-full (I'm being optimistic here, get it?) We chose this location for its proximity to the friends and relatives we visited. For 50-odd bucks you'll find some decent stretch-out area in a double-bed room. The bathroom provides ample space, has nice light (not those dial-timed sunlamps that always made me wonder why motel bathrooms needed to be equipped with them), a large, clean mirror and standard tub. Problem is, VERY LOW WATER PRESSURE and a faucet that would be one level below a Rubiks Cube, in terms of successfully operating. A note on the shower wall (!) explains how to use it.. something to do with radio dials; don't ask. Not to mention, the water took awhile to heat up. Yet, looking at the bright side.. friendly, efficient lobby staff and housekeepers allowed us to enjoy our stay! Although, for sixty bones, I could see myself shopping for something a little more exciting next time.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: mineer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during infusioncon which was at the Arizona Biltmore. I was so busy I spent very little time at the hotel. Slept there and that was about it. Didn't try the breakfast and never even watched the tv. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel isn't new but well taken care of. I didn't try out the pool or anything. I liked the location. Only about 5 minutes from the Biltmore. I went out to East Mesa to play basketball 2 mornings and it was only a couple minutes to get on the 202 so I felt like it was easy to get places. I didn't go further downtown but that would be close also. It does seem to be in an older part of town. I didn't eat near the hotel but some in my group did and they talked highly of some of the nearby restaurants they found. Doesn't seem to be a whole light within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bbtraveler0412
Reviews.Content: I stay at La Quinta as much as I can, I can count on them being clean and comfortable. Melissa the girl that checked me in was very helpful and when I told her I left my phone charger at the last hotel, she gave me hers to use even though she was working the next day.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: We often stay with La Quinta Inns for their excellent rooms, pet friendly enviornment and the customer service from management and staff. On a recent stay we had an unexpected complication that took us away from the Hotel for an extended time. Mr. Patel and his staff went way beyond what we could expect to accomadate our extended stay and help us with our dogs. Wonderful people, great location. Can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great people”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom123456
Reviews.Content: Front desk and manager were all very friendly when i checked in. Even though the hotel was busy the front desk were still attentive to me. The hotel itself is also very clean and pretty.. Especially the view from my room over the pool was great. Room was typical la quinta quality.. Clean comfortable and well made. No complaints. Overall i will stay at this hotel again in the future .

Reviews.Title: “great value for a great room”
Reviews.Author: Robin C
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice and clean. and even though there were many pets there(dog show in town) it was very quiet and well kept. the room had a jacuzzi in it, which was wonderful after a long day.Check in was very easy and customer service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional”
Reviews.Author: mstrockbine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times, and have had nothing but the most accommodating service and hospitality. The grounds are great ( I stay with my dogs) and my room has always been more than satisfactory. The fanciest La Quinta, no. But the convenience of the location and the quality of the staff and management make it a very nice place to stay. I'll be staying there again in the future, and many times after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Could use an update soon, but the biggest plus at this hotel was the excellent customer service. From Check in, to Check out and during the stay; the manager is actively walking the property taking care of any issue. Friendly staff that keeps the guests happy. As a single woman, I never worried about security. Cameras located all around the property and parking lot. I saw Staff visable on property early morning (5am) and late evening (9pm).

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Logisticsman123
Reviews.Content: Nice la quinta inn that is clean and very friendly. The hotel is unique because of its beautiful green courtyard. I have never seen that in other hotels and it is very clean and relaxing. I would stay here again because the rooms were large and comfortable. Just look at the picture of the courtyard :)

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: jorge_v
Reviews.Content: The property appears to have had little spent on it in the last 10 years. Although the grounds are well maintained, our room had dated fixtures, worn carpet, non functioning lights and hairdryer,and a general seedy feel to it. Not up to the standards of other La Quintas.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you pack earplugs”
Reviews.Author: curlydolls
Reviews.Content: Good rates, rooms older but in good shape, linens nothing spectacular but decent . Had requested downstairs, nothing available. The deskclerk upgraded us to a kitchenette room so we would not have far to walk from the elevator. (Staff were all quite helpful) VERY well lit place, could not get the room dark at night,light slipped in under door and above curtains). Parking area off to the side and didn't feel real safe, even in daylight. Walkways were well lit, but left me looking in and around corners to see what might be lurking. Pool area and reception area quite nice. Had the misfortune of being next to a lodger who apparently returned to his room quite drunk and singing at 3 AM. Walls and doors very thin-you hear EVERYTHING inside and out.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate & close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Philip H
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean but the furnishings, carpet etc were a little run down; beds were adequate. Old style TV.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, older place, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Robear46
Reviews.Content: Average older hotel. Didn't feel the parking was safe as it was dark. The rooms vary quite a bit so look at the room before you check in. Their WiFi is terrible. Pool are is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at La Quinta , Phoenix-Arcadia”
Reviews.Author: Bill939
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this motel. It is clean, cheerful and convenient to airport, malls etc. Large rooms with refrig, microwave and 2nd sink. Very reasonably priced. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “good people, clean grounds”
Reviews.Author: travelingRNTX
Reviews.Content: i love the staff. have only had one problem (stay once a month), and that was a Rewards program issue. they accommodated me with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing in phoenix”
Reviews.Author: tracy m
Reviews.Content: my family an i went to a wedding in the being nov, i book a room at the la quinta phoenix arcadia location. the stay was very welcoming, the room was very nice where most la quinta are , but this one stand out for the heated pool an spa was very nice little bigger then most an very clean. the grounds was like a park setting with bbq an little pond it would make a nice place to enjoy a nice lunch/dinner, an with the pool/ spa close by all the better,an in the morning time we all went down for breakfast all la quinta has a great breakfast bar an again this one standed out they had little extar things , biscuits an gravy one morning an the next was eggs with meat which was very good,the staff was very friendly an helpful, i will differently go back back.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: NDColorado
Reviews.Content: The rooms all have an outside entrance, which guarantees some level of noise. The back of my room faced the parking lot and a busy road, so there was more noise than I'm used to. The room was nice but a street light right outside my window meant the room never got very dark, even with the curtains pulled tight. The room was clean but housekeeping didn't clean the toilet - and I assume didn't clean the tub - each day. Some of the front desk staff were friendly, as I've come to expect from LaQuinta, but one woman was very abrupt and loud. Overall, a decent value but I will probably pick a different location from now on.

Reviews.Title: “A Great way to pick up travelers from PHX”
Reviews.Author: bigfred12
Reviews.Content: This hotel has given us many excellent stays, the help are very helpful and pleasent to deal with. We often have family visiting from Germany and find it convenient to pick them up by taxi and come back to the hotel for a relaxing night before returning home. The rooms are excellent, clean and roomy. I am disabled and their ADA room with a roll-in shower really is nice for me. Their breakfast is nothing to get excited about - but adequate. Overall the experience has always been Great!

Reviews.Title: “Pets were happy”
Reviews.Author: Gingersky
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to a wedding once again with my dogs. I love La Quinta for their policy on traveling pets! The grounds and room were very clean and lovely. The desk clerk was extremely helpful, bed was comfortable and my room was nice. An improvement would be to turn off the pool/spa pump when the pool is closed it makes a lot of noise which can be heard if your room is on that side. In general the hotel yard has a lot of mechanical noise at night and very bright lights outside the windows. It's be nice to see those lights shielded or better, dimmed for sleeping. The block out curtains do not seal on the sides or the bottom so light bright light enters near the bed from the window and the door. It's been proven that brights lights at night can interfere with a restful nights sleep. (One cannot enjoy natural daylight for waking.)

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: notkersegg
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much: good prices, nice swimming pool, excellent breakfast included

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard! Very Green!”
Reviews.Author: willjohnson_11
Reviews.Content: I had a nice and clean room at this la quinta. no problems with the breakfast or anything like that. it was a good hotel for me and anyone that needs a place to stay im writing this review to just say that i loved the courtyard. the owner obviously loves plants. there were roses and palm trees and some very weird looking but exotic plants. i really didn't know this hotel was so nice from the outside. thank you for reading this and hope you have a good stay like me.

Reviews.Title: “Worst LQ to date”
Reviews.Author: bdxsfo
Reviews.Content: I'm and elite memeber and I stay at LQ all the time and this was the only time I've ever had to check out of a room. It still had garbage from the last guest and it smelled terrible and the bathroom was falling apart. LQ corporate treated me like it was my fault and I was wasting their time, I was very unsatisfied with the entire situation and customer service was very poor. I had to check out and find another hotel and would not recommend this location to anyone. Pay a little more and stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: DC4ME
Reviews.Content: This is a great "cheap" hotel. You can walk to Target and Fry's (grocery) and there are several bus stops close by. It's also close to a running path and restaurants. $16 cab ride from the airport (5 miles)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Motel in a Nasty Area”
Reviews.Author: starfish008
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely filthy dirty in a neighborhood of strip clubs, porn shops and "lingerie" stores. Hooker fight in the hall until midnight. What a hideous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRB13
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for various excursions in the Phoenix area- Certainly not a 5 star hotel (not a classy neighborhood, not the best maintenance of breakfast area, worn linens and towels) but definitely worth a look for those on a budget

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: roop111
Reviews.Content: I have been at this hotel for over a year working in the Phoenix Az.. The hotel staff are great and very wonderful they have made my stay wonderful. Even the housekeepers are very wonderful and help the keep the rooms very clean and very nice.I would not stay at any other hotel when i am in Phoenix working.If you are looking for long stat or short stay or just the weekend this is the place to stay.You have places to eat within walking distance.You are located 5 minutes from the airport and if you ant to go shopping you are about 15 minutes from great places to shop at.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful, just like a second home. Excellet value!!”
Reviews.Author: vanna2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I relocated here from Baltimore Md and needed to stay somewhere until our apartment was ready. We first stayed at another hotel which was closer to the airport, but soon found out it was a mistake. After 2 nights we called around and found the La Quinta. Its still close about 2miles down the road. Right away, the person who answered the phone put us at ease. She was very friendly & took her time answering all our questions. The hotel is pet friendly (we have a puppy) and dosent require a "daily" pet rent like alot of others. Upon arrival, we noticed it was very nice from the outside. The lobby was very nice, clean, and offered free internet as well as Wi-Fi. Again, no hidden charges. There is a laundry facility on site, a pool/spa, fitness center & the grounds are very well kept & green. The la quinta is within walking distance to 2 large shopping centers,and even after traveling for a while, the rooms still had the "wow' effect. They are very spacious, micro/fridge work area, ice cold A/C and soft pillow-top mattress. We slept very well & had a hot breakfast. Again, no extra charge! All the employees are very helpful, and mangement is on-site for any problems. And to top it off the price is very reasonable. Staying at this La Quinta gave me a whole new perspective on what to expect. If Iam not home this is where I'll be. La Quinta - they leave the light on for ya ....and the A/C!!

Reviews.Title: “My go-to place in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: EuterpeThelo
Reviews.Content: It's no secret that I love the La Quinta chain, but this may have been my favorite one that I have stayed in yet. The pool was heated to such a perfect temperature that I didn't want to get out! Our room was clean and comfy, with a lovely little updated granite-lined shower and vanity tops. The grounds were very pretty with (like many LQs) a Spanish-style theme but there was an abundance of tranquil fountains, wrought-iron trim and moon/star decorations that made this particular LQ just that much nicer. I had a problem with my billing--they charged me higher than the rate I had confirmed at--but the onsite manager was so responsive and willing to help that he turned even THAT negative into a positive. My only nits were that the lights in the bathroom flickered unevenly, which was annoying, the microwave in the room was very, very old (I'm guessing early 1980s, seriously--see the photo I posted) and it was missing a leg so it was a little unstable, and the jacuzzi was nothing more than a very gentle wave and they told us it could not be adjusted from that (I prefer a really rolling jacuzzi). None of this was enough to keep me from wholeheartedly recommending this place, though. What a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Oasis”
Reviews.Author: reavley
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for one night and stayed for a further seven due to the Icelandic volcano! Eddie the friendly driver seemed always on hand to ferry us backwards and forwards to the airport as circumstances changed. David the manager was pleasant, flexible and helpful when we needed it most. The staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful and the hotel was more than clean and comfortable. Location was ideal with walkable supermarkets (Fry's), pizza parlors (check out Hungry Howies) and a great healthy option of 'Soup 'n Salad'. Prices for the rooms were competitive and all guests we met were really friendly and helpful. We plan to use this hotel when we are next in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: MouseGirl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel before heading off to Scottsdale for a few days of vacation, and was very impressed. I received a really great AAA rate and felt that I received excellent value for the money. The staff at the La Quinta were exceptionally friendly and accommodating, from Edward the shuttle driver to Cristal the front desk clerk. I loved the courtyard area with fountain and the beautiful, large, clean pool. The room was well-maintained with a comfortable bed, effective yet quiet air conditioning in the 100 degree heat, and a nice small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. They also provided a good complimentary breakfast in the morning and complimentary use of the computer in the lobby. The hotel was easy walking distance to restaurants and a shopping mall just down the street and as a solo female traveler I felt very safe walking at night in the area. I will definitely stay here again for future visits and have already recommended it to others staying in the Phoenix airport vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: jantravlz
Reviews.Content: It was 110 when we checked in, early in the afternoon, with the hotel being mostly empty. We got a very hot room, turned on the A/C full blast and left to meet with friends. Four hours later, the room was almost cooled down. There were cigarette burn holes in the bedspread, along with some suspicious stains. A lightbulb was missing in a lamp. The A/C had to be run at full blast all night to keep the room at an acceptable temperature---and it was extremely noisey. The room was inexpensive, but not worth what we paid. We were too exhausted to complain and move our belongings to another room. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Dexia1820
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our choice. All we needed was a nice room for one night at a motel with shuttle service close to the airport. We booked a double-bed room for $45. I was somewhat concerned that at this bargain price the motel would be located in a rundown section of town. Instead, we were surprised it was an attractive and very safe neighborhood with lots of stores and restaurants. For those who love shopping, there is a huge shopping center about half a mile away, which we discovered during our late evening walk. Since our room faced the busy road, I requested another one across the hall. The very pleasant and helpful receptionist assigned one at $55 but it came with a refrigerator and a microwave. Though the motel provides a continental breakfast, we elected to eat at the excellent Coco’s, just a block away. We were informed that the shuttle vehicle was inoperable but that LaQuinta would provide a taxi at their expense to drive us to the airport. Amazing, all that for $45. Fortunately, it turned out that the vehicle became available overnight. This motel was very clean; beds were great and the service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: yankeelass57
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the strength of it's handy location for the airport and a very reasonable price. Because of delayed flights we missed the last shuttle so took a taxi and as it neared the motel we began to wonder about the neighborhood. However, we found the property to be much better than expected with good sized rooms and a cheerful breakfast area. The public PC was a plus and the free airport shuttle a good feature. Staff were efficient without any warmth and the cleaning was less than perfect but for a night before or after a flight we found it to be very good value and convenient. The area looked much better by daylight though we found the eating options pretty limited. Pool was large and clean with garden area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: unklray
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Sunday evening and were pleasently surprised by the attractiveness of the property. I had suspected it wasn't new but the price was right, $79.00 AARP and we got a King Non Smoking room. This may be the best bed I have ever had in a hotel It was a pillow top, no memory foam, I hate memory foam style, just the right firmness. A mini suite with a microwave, sink and counter. Very clean. in excellent repair, I belive just remodeled. Not a huge room but certainly plenty large enough. cable TV. Not a flat screen but a good TV. The next AM we had breakfast in the breakfast room. nice and roomy with plenty of seating, choices included waffle maker, bagels, cereal, Good orange juice and other items. Free use of internet in the office, no wi-fi but I hate taking a computer with so this was perfect. The pool and hot tube were spotless and roomy. 8 foot deep for diving in pool. lots of flowers and 2 fountains. beautiful landscaping. Airport shuttle and walking distance to resturants, target etc. discount at Appleby's restrurant and Enterprise Car rental 3 blocks. We made reservations for two more nights at the end of our trip and were not dissapointed. We will definately stay there again/

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: srblue
Reviews.Content: Building was older but the grounds were well kept and the room still had all the typical La Quinta decor. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom large, closet, kitchen, safe in room, etc. There are a ton of stores and restaurants nearby, but I also felt a little uncomfortable coming back to the room at night - parking lot not extremely well lit and you couldn't see the cars from your room. Overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: HarleyLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights, was in town to visit family and friends. The only good thing about this place is the pool and jacuzzi. The staff has no personality, the sheets did not fit the bed properly, the location is not the best, although the breakfast bar was okay, the staff was in there constantly walking around and in the way of people trying to get food and drinks and lastly, it was Sunday morning at only 9am the the gardener had the leaf blower going and mowing the lawn. I had just gotten up but some people may want to sleep in on a Sunday morning, not be woken up by a lawn mower and leaf blower.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in area!”
Reviews.Author: HenryW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last year while visiting family in Tempe. We have found it to be the best budget option in the area. The property is convenient (within 15 minutes) of most places in Tempe, South Scottsdale, and Sky Harbor Airport. Shopping and moderately priced restaurants are just a few blocks West (including Costco). Some rooms have a "kitchenette ' with an extra sink, small fridge, and microwave oven - worth asking for! Airport transportation is tricky for early morning or late evening flights, so check when you make your reservation. WI-FI access was excellent, plus there is a public PC near the check-in desk. Breakfast was typical La Quinta, but the breakfast room was bright and cheerful with a very helpful attendant.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great bed”
Reviews.Author: DKRMontana
Reviews.Content: The good--GREAT BED--Denver Mattress is the best I've ever slept on. Very nice courtyard, unique. I didn't use the pool but it looked large and very clean. Close to airport and easy to locate, close to shopping etc. I attended a conference at the Marriott which took about 5-10 minutes to get there--easy to get on the main roads even at 8 in the morning. Most of the room looked recently renovated--new carpet fresh paint. Bed linen was clean, pillows were good. The so-so--microwave was ancient and noisy, the bathroom was adequate but outdated. 2nd room off street rooms were quiet enough which is what i had, but could see that street rooms or courtyard rooms by pool could be noisier. Lugging suitcases up the stairs was a drag--never did now where the elevator was. The not so good--the parking area is in back and a little creepy for a single woman--twice there was someone (probably staff) sitting in a vehicle when I pulled up. Other reviewers were correct that anyone off the street could be walking back there. Could be a lot better lit also. Also, the TV channel selection was very subpar--no local channel for news/weather--very bizarre. Instead lots of cartoons, comedy and MTV... Overall, this is good value for price and if not travelling alone I wouldn't hesitate to stay here--would consider even if I was alone again as nothing out of the ordinary happened, just that not the best set up on the parking area. Would be great for couples with kids due to the great courtyard and pool area--also nice location overall.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not everyone's cup of tea, but we liked it & so did our dogs.”
Reviews.Author: happytrails1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here while attending a trade show at the PHX Convention Center. We have "special needs," as we travel with 3 small dogs, and La Quinta is exceptionally accommodating for those of us who can't bear to leave the kids at a kennel. There wasn't a good exercise area on the property, but we discovered a fabulous walking/running path just a half block away, and that pleased everybody. Our ground floor room had a fridge & microwave in a kitchenette arrangement. The bed was comfortable & there were 2 closets. The only complaint I have about the quality of the accommodations was the bathroom, which was in dire need of remodeling. Because we were near the pool & hot tub, it got a little noisy in the evenings, but nothing serious. We had no problems whatsoever with the staff. The complementary breakfast was substantial & the breakfast room was spotless. The courtyard area was well-kept and lovely. La Quinta Sky Harbor gets 4 thumbs and 12 dew claws up from this crew.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrifying!! I checked in went to my room about 20 mins after checking in...had to run to grab a bottle of water from the store....then flipped on my light and my in room phone rang. It was the guy downstairs standing by the key card machine that worked for the hotel wondering if i wanted to go have a drink....of course being shocked i said no and hung up the phone. Right away i checked out knowing he had access to my room and i was staying by myself. It really scared me....i really didnt know what to do. I talked to the owner who was rude condesending and did not truly apologize for anything that his hotel was responsible for. He stated that he had been in the hotel business for over 30 years but CLEARLY did not take steps in his OWN hotel to keep his guests safe and secure during their stay...I WILL NEVER STAY AT ANOTHER LA QUINTA EVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: 123456789x
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to pay more than this hotel costs, do not stay here. Our party had 9 family members in four different rooms and none of will ever stay here again. The service is not friendly or speedy, the rooms are mediocre, the beds are saggy, my husband and daughter both had holes in either their sheets or their comforter, the shuttle to the airport does not leave until 7:00 AM, I had to search for the desk person in order to check out, the computer would not connect to the internet to print boarding passes. There is more, just beware, we did not have a pleasant stay and have nothing good to say except the courtyard is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Outdated, but Nice”
Reviews.Author: flyfishing11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was among the cheapest that offered a shuttle to Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. For the most part, I thought the hotel offered everything that you look for. The beds were comfortable, the shower had decent pressure, and the staff was helpful. The room that I stayed in was a little bit outdated. The carpet should probably be replaced and the room could have used a fresh coat of paint. However, it appears that the hotel is in the process of remodeling. The courtyard at the hotel is very attractive. They have a couple of pools and a little "stream" that flows through the courtyard. They also have an outdoor pool and a hottub. The room I had was also a bit noisy. I had a room that was located on the street. I could hear some street traffic throughout the night. There was also a screaming baby that had been placed in the room across the hall from me. Overall, these noises did not bother me, but I would sleep if a train happened to pass through the room in the middle of the night. Overall, I thought that this hotel was decent enough. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but Quite, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: The property has been around for awhile but it is well maintained. The room was very quiet, comfortable and clean. It was nice to have a refrigerator and microwave. The courtyard and pool area are very attractive. Well-maintained plantings of flowers always say the owners care about the property. Overall very nice and affordable for in season on Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryAD
Reviews.Content: It was 15-20 min drive from the airport car rental area in a nice part of town. The room was nice, clean. The pool looked nice though we didn't try it. An upstairs room would be quieter as we could hear footsteps from above. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahPeace
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was wonderful. After taking a look at the place we decided to ask for a room in the courtyard, overlooking the pool area. Although this is a bit more expensive it is certainly worth the money since it is quiet and provides a lovely view. The pool was fabulous- there was no one else there at the time and it is larger than most hotel pools. The palm trees and fountain provide added ambiance. The staff was friendly and helpful, they provided us with advice about places to eat, shopping, etc. The breakfast is a basic but good continental breakfast. The rooms were clean, spacious and the cooler quiet. The neighborhood might not be the best but it is close (within 10 minutes driving distance) of many restaurants, shopping areas, etc. All in all- for this price in Phoenix- this is a perfect spot. Plus they provide transportation to the Airport (which is easy to get to driving yourself as well though it does take 20 minutes or so). I don't know what people expect for this price, but we were thoroughly satisfied. In comparison to some of the Marriots that we looked at this place had so much more personality and style, we will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel and was disappointed. We had just stayed in a La Quinta inn and suites in NW Tucson/Marana which was very nice and I expected this La Quinta to be the same or nicer---it was not. The parking was horrible (I would not want to be a female alone in that parking lot at night) if your room was located at the other end of the hotel (there was only one elevator)--it was like walking a block or more(with all your luggage--no dollies for upstairs rooms) from getting off the elevator to get to your room, however, I did feel safer with our room being further inside the hotel. Do not get a room that faces the street if you plan on trying to sleep the next morning---traffic began at 5:00am and it was very noisy. We had asked if we could have a room change because we had been in Tucson earlier in the week and had to get up every morning at 5:00am, so we wanted to be able to sleep the two nights that we were in Phoenix---the staff would not change my room unless I wanted to pay more money---I did not. The beds were clean and comfortable, but the bathroom shower/tub did not look clean and the bath towels were very small, thin, worn, and dirty looking. The shower curtain needed to be replaced. It was quiet at night for sleeping, but the morning traffic was awful. It was a convenient location, but I would not stay at this particular La Quinta again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BY5260
Reviews.Content: I am a weekly business traveler. I stay in a hotel room almost nightly. This location is probably the WORST I've ever actually stayed at. I typically obtain my rooms thru Priceline and I'd never dare bid again in this zone for fear I'd get this location. I read the other comments and either they were written by the owners, or these people stayed at another property. Check-in was rude, probably because I was a Priceline customer. I was given a smoking room even though I had clearly indicated on my Priceline requests for NON-SMOKING only. They would not even think about putting me in a non-smoking room. The entire property looks dirty and worn-out! I'm amazed LaQuinta allows their name to be associated with this location. As I parked to go to my room, a homeless individual was present in the parking lot and seemed to have an interest in what I was removing from my vehicle. When I got to the room and started checking for bed bugs (I'd just watched the 20/20 report on this problem) I found drug paraphernalia. This really is not a location or room that most would be satisfied with. The bathroom smelled of old urine.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: cthill
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before heading to Flagstaff and the Grand Canyon and two nights before returning to the East Coast. We had a room downstairs facing the road on our first stay, and an upstairs room facing the courtyard on our second stay. Both rooms were clean and pleasant, if a little small - pretty standard basic hotel rooms with two double beds. The air conditioning units in both rooms had no trouble with the 95 to 100 degree Phoenix heat. The road noise was mimimal - no problem. There was a group using the pool right up to the 10:00 P.M. cutoff time on our second stay, but it was quiet after that. We used the pool and jacusi in the late afternoon before our return flight. Both were clean and seemed to be well maintained The staff was polite and accomodating. The breakfast is above average for a medium priced hotel. This is a city hotel in a mixed middle class residential and commericial neighborhood. It is convenient to the airport, shopping malls, and there are many diverse places to eat nearby. We never felt there was a problem with security. We were 100 per-cent satisfied. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a very nic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta Inn North, in Beginning of September. I had got a good reference from a friend who stayed their previously. I called the hotel directly, becasue you can get a better deal direclty from the hotel, then some of the websites. Anyhows, i was greeted by a female front desk person who was very polite and patient with my questions to her. She gave me excellent directions to the hotel and around the area. I noticed that the oter employees were very helpful in getting me around town. The room that i stayed in was also very nice. It appeared that the room had just been renovated with the rest of the hotel. I have stayed at other LQs, but this was very unique. The landscaping was very nice, and well taken care of, and the water fountains were very relaxing. my friends recommended the hotel to me, and i would recommed it to others

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice extras”
Reviews.Author: SouthwesternLass
Reviews.Content: Several friends and I drove to Phoenix recently to visit a friend, and I took on the task of booking us a hotel room before we left. Based on several friends recommending the La Quinta chain, I chose this one, which was near our friend's house. From the description on the website, it fit our budget and had the amenities we were looking for, so we figured it would be a good place to stay. I booked the room by calling the hotel directly and actually got a better price than what I'd found at various travel websites. The woman who took my reservation was friendly and helpful. And when we arrived there in person, we got an even *better* rate. Indeed it worked out for us well. The lobby is nice and welcoming, the hotel is in an area that has convenient shopping nearby, and our room had several 'extras' that made staying there nice. It's not an ultra swanky gourmet hotel, nor is it a scary fleabag hotel. It's a nice, standard, middle ground place, which felt clean, welcoming and affordable. In our room, which had two double beds, was a little fridge, a microwave, a coffee maker with coffee & supplies provided, and a nice large closet. I liked the fact that the hotel gives you the option of not having your bed linens washed daily, if you so choose, in order to save water. The bathroom seemed standard enough. The usual soaps and tiny shampoos were supplied, and basic towels. Though we never used the microwave, it was nice to know we *could* have used it if we needed it, and we did use the fridge and the coffeemaker. I have to say though, bring your own coffee if you care at all about what your coffee tastes like. This coffee just didn't cut it for us. This is because we like to drink really, really good coffee. Still, though, it was nice to have. The beds were ok, but not the best--they were a bit slanty. But they were comfortable enough. I think all of us wished we'd brought our own pillows, too, but we're picky pillow people. The pillows supplied ranged from really flat to somewhat poofy, so if you're particular, you may want to bring your own. Other perks included the outdoor heated pool and jacuzzi tub. We *definitely* made use of that jacuzzi both nights we were there, and it really made our stay. It was one reason we chose that place--we wanted a place with a jacuzzi. It was large and clean. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice. There was also a workout room, but according to my friends who used it, it wasn't the greatest. The treadmill seemed old and cranky. The free continental breakfast was nice--especially because you can make your own fresh waffles. There are two waffle irons and premixed batter and someone standing there to help if you don't know how to work the iron. They were quite nice. Also provided are fresh fruits, cereals, packaged muffins and pastries, breads for toast, juices (from a machine, but ok enough), and the aforementioned weak coffee. A decent continental breakfast indeed; I've stayed at places with really shabby ones compared to this. So, overall, I'd say this was a good place to stay, and we all agreed we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Italophile
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found it very comfortable. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard where the pool area is. It was nicely landscaped with flowers, two fountains, and green grass. The breakfast room was cheerful and the breakfast was good (make your own waffles, cereals, bagels, muffins, fruit, coffee, juices, etc.). Our room was a good size and clean. Our room included a small refrigerator, coffee pot, and microwave. The staff were very polite and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Truck Was Stolen There”
Reviews.Author: 00HappyTraveler00
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is advertised as a park and stay. Do not do it. I left my truck there from 11/18 – 11/28 to find no truck, they did not even know it was gone !!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Phoenix - Arcadia
HotelInfo.Address: 4727 East Thomas Road, Phoenix, AZ 85018
